job_title: Investigations in laser processing of composite materials
job_description: JOB DESCRIPTIONDue to their special material properties, fiber-reinforced composites play an integral role in the aerospace and automotive industry as well as in the production of sports equipment and in the construction of wind power plants.At LZH, laser-based machining processes and systems are being developed in order to meet the challenges mentioned above. Laser-based processes for the material processing of composites with the advantages of wear-free and force-free machining are already successfully applied at the LZH in the following areas:Cutting/Trimming; Drilling; Surface activation/cleaning; 3D-Structuring.Possible Tasks are:laser and optics installation and adjustmentperforming practical investigations during laser processesqualifying the results by analysis with microscopes, SEM, confocal profiler, etc.production of CFRP and GFRP materials for laser experimentsresearch on and development of possibilities for process control as pyrometry, thermography, high speed cameras and programming (LabView, CNC-Code)numerical simulation of heat conduction using ANSYS
job_requirements: Preferred skills:good background knowledge and some hands-on experience of optics and lasersknowledge in CAD (e.g. AutoCAD),  LabView or ANSYSbasic knowledge in physicspractical approach to work and solving problemsinterested to work independently in a challenging field Open To All Majors:No
